mainBoard.name: Academy Rector

rulings.text: You do not have to find an enchantment card if you do not want to, even if you have one in your library.
An enchantment card is any Enchantment card, including Auras.

mainBoard.text: When Academy Rector dies, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.name: Birds of Paradise
mainBoard.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

mainBoard.flavorText:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
mainBoard.name: Llanowar Elves
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.
mainBoard.name: Priest of Titania

rulings.text: Priest of Titania's ability counts all Elves on the battlefield. This includes Priest of Titania itself as well as Elves controlled by other players.

Priest of Titania's ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and players can't respond to it. Notably, this means other players can't try to remove Elves from the battlefield after you activate this ability but before it resolves.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G} for each Elf on the battlefield.

mainBoard.name: Serra Avatar

rulings.text: If Serra Avatar is no longer in your graveyard when its triggered ability resolves, you still shuffle your library.
The ability that defines Serra Avatar’s power and toughness works in all zones, not only the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
Serra Avatar's power and toughness are each equal to your life total.
When Serra Avatar is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

mainBoard.flavorText: The Brothers' War scarred the land, but Ashnod left her mark in the bloodlines of those she tortured.
mainBoard.name: Ashnod's Altar
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Uh, does anyone have a flute?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
mainBoard.name: Snake Basket

rulings.text: It used to make Cobra tokens. Now it makes Snake tokens.

mainBoard.text: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Create X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens. Activate only as a sorcery.

mainBoard.flavorText:
To hone swords and dull minds.
—Whetstone inscription
mainBoard.name: Whetstone

rulings.text: Can be used if a player has less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, each affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

mainBoard.text: {3}: Each player mills two cards.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor
mainBoard.name: Enlightened Tutor

rulings.text: The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I don't understand why he works so hard on a device to duplicate a sound so easily made with hand and armpit."
—Barrin, progress report
mainBoard.name: Confiscate

rulings.text: Gaining control of a permanent doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.
Gaining control of an Aura or Equipment doesn't change what it's attached to.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant permanent
You control enchanted permanent.

mainBoard.flavorText: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.
mainBoard.name: Fecundity

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, if a player loses the game, triggered abilities that player controls are removed from the stack and no more from that player can be added. This means that if a creature an opponent controls dies while you control Fecundity, and you lose the game before Fecundity’s triggered ability resolves (perhaps because you lost the game at the same time that the creature died), that player won’t draw a card.

mainBoard.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.

mainBoard.name: Pattern of Rebirth

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.
Searching for a creature card is optional.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller may search their library for a creature card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

mainBoard.name: Saproling Cluster
mainBoard.text: {1}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token. Any player may activate this ability.

mainBoard.name: Yawgmoth's Bargain
mainBoard.text:
Skip your draw step.
Pay 1 life: Draw a card.

mainBoard.name: Yawgmoth's Will

rulings.text: If an effect asks you to discard a card, you can’t “discard” something that is in your graveyard. Those cards are not in your hand. Thus, Cycling abilities of cards in the graveyard can’t be activated.
If you cast a Buyback spell, then there will be two effects trying to replace where the card goes. You get to choose if the Buyback returns the card to your hand or the card gets exiled.
If you play a card using Yawgmoth’s Will and something triggers only when “cast from your hand”, that something will not trigger. Such things trigger based on where the card came from.
It will exile itself since it goes to the graveyard after its effect starts.
The second ability creates a replacement effect. It applies to both costs and effects.
To “play a card” is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
You cannot Suspend a card from your graveyard, only your hand.

mainBoard.text:
Until end of turn, you may play lands and cast spells from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

mainBoard.name: Brushland
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

mainBoard.name: City of Brass

rulings.text: If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.
The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

mainBoard.flavorText: If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.
mainBoard.name: High Market
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.

mainBoard.name: Phyrexian Tower
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Add {B}{B}.

mainBoard.name: Thran Quarry

rulings.text: Triggers at the end of every player’s turn.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

sideBoard.flavorText: The strength of law is unwavering. It is an iron bar in a world of water.
sideBoard.name: Absolute Law

rulings.text: This affects all creatures, not just your own.

sideBoard.text: All creatures have protection from red.

sideBoard.flavorText: Jamuraa's rhystic mages treat magic as their garden, uprooting unwanted spells as bothersome weeds.
sideBoard.name: Aura Fracture
sideBoard.text: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.

sideBoard.name: Blaze
sideBoard.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician
sideBoard.name: Defense Grid

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don't cost extra on your own turn.

sideBoard.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.

sideBoard.flavorText: Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.
sideBoard.name: Energy Flux
sideBoard.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

sideBoard.flavorText: Ramos bled, and there was fire.
sideBoard.name: Heart of Ramos

rulings.text: You can activate the sacrifice ability while this card is tapped.

sideBoard.text:
{T}: Add {R}.
Sacrifice Heart of Ramos: Add {R}.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"I do not miss sunlight. The very memory of it burns my eyes."
—Volrath
sideBoard.name: Light of Day
sideBoard.text: Black creatures can't attack or block.

sideBoard.flavorText: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.
sideBoard.name: Meekstone
sideBoard.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

sideBoard.name: Parallax Wave
sideBoard.text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Wave: Exile target creature.
When Parallax Wave leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards they own exiled with Parallax Wave.

sideBoard.name: Phyrexian Processor

rulings.text: You can pay 0 life if you want, but it's not useful most of the time.

sideBoard.text:
As Phyrexian Processor enters, pay any amount of life.
{4}, {T}: Create an X/X black Phyrexian Minion creature token, where X is the life paid as Phyrexian Processor entered.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."
—Seal inscription
sideBoard.name: Seal of Cleansing

rulings.text: Sacrificing Seal of Cleansing is the cost to activate its ability. Once you activate the ability, no player can do anything to Seal of Cleansing to stop you from activating it. Notably, if you cast Seal of Cleansing during your turn, you'll have priority to activate its ability before anyone can respond to stop you.

sideBoard.text: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra
sideBoard.name: Worship

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

sideBoard.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
